name: Kenmore 600 Series Friendly Lightweight Bagged Canister Vacuum with Pet PowerMate, Pop-N-Go Brush, 2 Motors, HEPA Filter, Aluminum Telescoping Wand, Retractable Cord and 4 Cleaning Tools, Purple
about_this_item: BAGGED CANISTER VACUUM: Multipurpose design w/swivel head cleans all areas and surfaces in your home, den, kitchen, car and garage.Suction power(hose end) ‚â•183W. Number of Amps 12.Cleaning Width (in.) : 14, Features : Multi Surface.

POWERFUL CLEANING: 2-motor system excels in suction strength and includes 2 floor nozzles with exclusive Pop-N-Go floor brush. 3 additional attachments are included: crevice tool, dirt brush and bare floor tool
TRIPLE HEPA FILTER SYSTEM: Enhanced HEPA filter traps 99. 97% of dirt, trapping dirt inside the vacuum

PET POWERMATE & POP-N-GO BRUSH: Motorized attachment lifts stubborn pet hair, and dirt quickly from surfaces. Eliminates hair from tangling around the brush.Stores inside vacuum, attaches to handle and wand in a snap for bare floor cleaning

ALUMINUM TELESCOPING WAND: Adjustable lightweight wand lengthens to an extended reach of 10. ' to access difficult areas. Lightweight at 22. 6 lbs, 28' cord is retractable, accessories and attachments fit within vac

title: strong
content: I have been wanting a canister for some time and I do not regret buying this one. It has strong suction and does a great job on carpets & bare flooring. All the tools are useful with convent storage. It has a pull when using, can't explain well, when vacuuming but I think that is due to the suction some how. The suction is adjustable with a slider.  You can attach the hose with attachment to the bottom side of the vac., and sit the vac., on its back end for storage, takes up less room. The bag is huge. Hose length is good and power cord good length. I like the fact you can just step on a button and bring the power cord back in. Noise level about med loud, I have had louder. I feel a GOOD vacuum is an investment and I hope to have this one for long time to come, tired of looking for a GOOD vacuum. I do recommend this canister vacuum.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2024

I have to adjust the height and the suction to prevent that from happening. It also is not made as sturdily. It‚Äôs OK and I‚Äôm glad I got it. title: Nice vaccum but wrong price.
content: We replaced an aging Miele vacuum cleaner with this one. Neither the Miele nor the Kenmore are perfect but both are good products. The Miele was a lot more expensive but had two irritating flaws... The wheels wouldn't roll over the electric cord so always getting stuck, and there was no power switch on the wand. This new Kenmore has all the features that we like, including that switch and the ability to roll over the cord, but the hose is slightly shorter, which sometimes forces me to pick up the canister when vacuuming up high. It does weigh less than the Miele. Overall, it's a good product. We have another older Kenmore canister vacuum that has held up beautifully.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024

The pet tool can do vertical stair risers.

title: Verified Purchase
content: To say I have purchased a few vacuums over the years would be an understatement. I am easily taken in by the shiny bright new gadget that promises to clean my carpets better than ever. Well, after my latest dismal venture into the world of cordless stick vacs, I decided I needed to return to the basics. I stumbled on this machine by searching for top-rated vacuums and boy am I glad I did. This thing is a beast! In 'carpet' mode it basically runs itself, you just hold on for dear life as it drags you around the room. The tools are easily accessible and powerful, and the retractable cord is a fantastic touch.  I noticed a difference in the look and feel of my carpets after the first use. Now, this vacuum is not for everyone - it's heavy and a bit cumbersome but overall, I'm glad I made the switch!

title: Verified Purchase
content: I have been a Kenmore canister vacuum user for 20+ years. I had my first one (refurbished) that lasted me 10 years. Then my second one, throughout my 10 years as a cleaning lady (cleaned A LOT of houses), and finally just purchased my third one. I upgraded to this model because I really like the ability to use my foot to release the carpet attachment and go right to the hardwood floors without having to attach the floor attachment piece. As a Kenmore canister user, I was a little skeptical upon opening it because I noticed for the first time this floor piece attachment is very different from all their other models and I like their floor piece so much! But so far so good! It does seem to do as great, if not a better job than the older models. My hands-down reason for this vacuum is, as a cleaning lady, I have vacuumed many houses and the motorized powered pet mate attachment is just a must for me that I can't live without and no other vacuum on the market has. It is the only way (to me) to clean carpeted stairs, or stairs with a runner, or furniture (think under the couch cushions!) especially if you have pets. A regular suction attachment just doesn't do it! You need the motorized power. My only complaints would be that I'm disappointed in the flimsy cover. It is thinner plastic than the previous models, and doesn't feel like it would hold up well to high use, however, with the floor attachment already attached with an easy step release button, maybe it won't be a high use feature. The other negative is that the height of the carpet attachment is a tad bit higher than the previous models and doesn't quite fit all the way under my couch with ease as the other ones did. They still have the full swivel so you can make your vacuum pretty flat when you swivel the handle down, but the part where the hose attaches is larger or sticks up more so I have to swivel a certain way and go a little slower than I could with the other models. I should add that I first ordered the plush carpet (the newest model before this one) first, as I wanted this one but it was out of stock with no date of when it would be back and I needed it! That one slid nicely under my couch with ease! But the cord was a foot or two shorter and did not reach around to my back door like previous models and like this one does, so I'm happy to have the longer cord again. Overall, no one outdoes the suction power or motor power of a Kenmore canister, and the pet-mate powered attachment is a deal-breaker that no others have so this vacuum is definitely worth the money if you are looking for a quality piece, I just wish Kenmore would not cut corners on the body (flimsy plastic) like it feels like they are. I'm not sure why, if it makes the vacuum lighter? But overall I am very happy with my new (and pretty!) vacuum and expect to get a good 10-20 years out of this one!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021

title: Might be a ReCon
content: EDIT:  The post below this paragraph is how I felt after using the vacuum for a couple of months.  However about 4 months after purchasing, the hose attachment broke at where it attaches to the vacuum.  The hose is where you turn it on, so you can't use it if it's not connected.  Submitted the warranty request to Kenmore the next day. Called every couple of weeks to check in and was told the part was on backorder.  There was a miscommunication around 2 months in, where a representative told me they had some in stock and that I would be getting the replacement within a couple of weeks.  That was not the case, so when I called 3 weeks later and was told that they were still on back order, their way to remedy the situation was to have me wait another month and see if it came in, and then if it didn't they would offer an entire vacuum replacement. Safe to say it was still on back order, so at the end of Month 3 (almost month 4), I submitted all my info the request was approved 5 days later. The form I submitted said "You should receive your replacement within 5-7 business days once processed" but the "Order Processed" email said 25-31 business days, so I waited a month to call and check on the order/see if I could get a tracking number.  Lo and behold the vacuum is on backorder as well. So if you're looking to buy this and feel good about it because it comes with a warranty, just know they outsource their vacuum warranty support, everything is on backorder, and if you bought the extended warranty through Amazon, Amazon won't do anything because the vacuum is covered under the manufacturer warranty for the first year.  At this rate, I won't be surprised if I don't receive my replacement by Black Friday, and for that I'm docking stars.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023

title: Great vacuum, HORRIBLE WARRANTY
content: We decided to go for a bagged vacuum since we have 5 cats, a dog, and 3 long haired humans and this thing is A BEAST!  It has great suction, plenty of attachments and the hose is long and has a large diameter so you don't have to worry about things getting stuck in there.  The maneuvering of the PowerMate attachment (the main vacuum head) takes some getting used to, but it's nothing that won't get better with practice. The telescoping wand is my husband's favorite feature. It's super handy for teaching the ceiling and getting the top of the cabinets.  Personally, I love the PetPowerMate attachment. I've never been able to get all the pet hair off of my couch so quickly. Normally with our old set up it would take 2-3 hours to unweave the pet hair out of the tweed-like fabric that makes up our couch, but with this thing it takes no more than 15 minutes. It's a life saver.  I no longer dread vacuuming my house!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2024

title: The best vacuum in the world
content: So I LOVE Kenmore vacuums because of their reliability and they get the job done right! I've had at least 4 - which says a lot because it's the only brand I've owned in my 75 years. We have established they last, they have great suction and a variety of tool attachments. This one is bigger, heavier and more tricky to get parts together (and no it's not due to my age!). So I'm a manual reader (you guessed it, I'm not a man LOL) so the first thing I did after reading it was check everything out -open every nook and cranny. Don't check the rear filter! I spent over an hour trying to get it back in. Once I removed the filter to check it out and tried to replace it I could not get the cover to stay on. Each time I turned on the vacuum, it blew it across the room with rocket force (luckily this didn't break the cover). I could replace the cover easily without installing the filter - I eventually had to put the whole canister on the hose end and use my entire body weight to get that cover back in place. One thing's for sure it has a TIGHT seal - the next time I think that needs replacing, I'll be inviting a man over - hopefully he'll be stronger. My second displeasure is that having the floor attachment fit into the rug attachment makes it heavier & less manageable - it is wider than previous models I've had and doesn't fit under some furniture due to it's increased height. The crevice nozzle attaches under the handle (instead of being inside the canister with other tools) and it requires a extra firm yank to remove it and a study wack to reattach it. It has a few more bells & whistles than I've had in the past, but I'm not overly convinced yet they are worth the extra $$$. For instance, the dirt sensor comes on if it senses there is still something bouncing around in front of it - it's come on a couple times, but not in the high traffic areas where you would expect it- so am I convinced it's reliable? The slide button on the handle that changes it from floor to carpet moves too easily down to the carpet setting and the suction adjustment just below that is easily changed without meaning to if you grab that area to move the whole wand. Where the hose goes into the canister is not as smooth a fit and likewise the handle of that hose into the pole attached to the floor attachments. The floor light on the wand only comes one when using the carpet selection and isn't as bright or cover as much area as my previous model that had the light on a separate rug attachment. The suction is as good as they make and I do care about how well it cleans, so it will remain with me. It does have a longer cord, a fan cleaning brush, an indicator light for when the bag is full. But be prepared for a bigger, less mobile, heavier machine - if you're frail, can't lift 30 lbs easily and you're not a bit mechanical: look for something else. If you just want clean and have the extra bucks, you'll like this one. And it's such a girlie color...don't you hate reviews that just tell you about the color?
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024

title: A Really Great Vacuum, Except for one thing.
content: Have had this vacuum cleaner for a couple years now and really think it‚Äôs top notch. It has great suction, it‚Äôs not too noisy, and is adaptable to any type of floor covering. Some have complained about the retractable cord, but I find it is great and so convenient for storage. The trick is to not expect it to retract cord if it is in anyway bound up.  It takes just a second to release the cord from any hindrance before pressing the button to rewind, and sometimes takes a couple tries to get it completely wound up. If it does stop without getting all the cord in the machine, I just give it a light pull to reset it, and push the button again and and the cord always winds up.  It‚Äôs such an advantage, instead of having to wrap the cord around the machine. And all the attachments sit neatly in the machine and don‚Äôt fall out.

I thought a replacement would be easy to find, however I got the wrong size. What I ordered was for the standard Kenmore and was too small. My advice is Yes by all means buy this vacuum cleaner, you‚Äôll love it - but then in additio,  order a bare floor replacement brush with it.  Search ‚ÄúKenmore 600 vacuum replacement parts‚Äù where you‚Äôll see an ordinary brush attachment. It seems Kenmore thought this new brush would be adaptable to all angles but it just never worked for me.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought several vacuums on prime day. I have two Great Pyrenees mixes and a Newfie. They absolutely love to dig holes and sleep in them. I have tried just about every vacuum there is and they either break, don‚Äôt vacuum dirt, fling the dirt, smell horrible, get clogged, or eat my area rugs. This vacuum did none of that. The raising feature is the best and allows for all floor types including shag throw rugs! It did not smell one bit. It is so powerful. It sucked up all the dirt and hair so easily. It has a very long cord. The bag held so much and still isn‚Äôt full. So worth the purchase. The one and only downfall is because it is so lightweight the actual handle and hose part does tip over very easily. But again I will never be buying another vacuum again.

title: Does a great job
content: Well, my old Hoover bit the dust so I was needing a new one for the first floor. Specifically for carpet. I like a canister because you can reach under the bed or sofas. I looked at some videos from reviewers and read reviews. I decided that the 600 series had the attachments that I really needed. I like the crevice tool for getting into small spaces. The upholstery brush is a must have for the couch. The pet attachment I haven't used. The first thing that impressed me about this vacuum was the suction power. This thing wanted to take off as soon as I turned it on. No joke! It does have a wide suction head so you cover a larger area quicker. Cleans really nice as well. You also can attach the long wand and hang it on the canister itself for storage. To me, this is worth the increase in price from the 200 series. By the way, it does use HEPA filter bags so as to not let dust get back into the air. It comes with one.  Professionals say this is better than bagless vacuums.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Cheap POS with a $400 price tag. The old kenmore vacuums no longer exist. This was shipped to me less than 1 year and 2 months ago. THIS next section was my previous review. Ok I wanted another Kenmore vacuum because I've always used Kenmore canister vacuums. My first one was purchased in 1979 and lasted for years. My 2nd "premium"Kenmore was very good and I still use it but it busted in a couple of places after us fell down a flight of steps so a little bit of hassle to use. I tried to purchase the best canister model that was sold by Sears and then Kenmore on Amazon but after I ordered I received notice they were out of stock. So I bought this one. It's supposed to be the same but a different color.  It's much more cheaply made than my previous Kenmore Vac. The wheels are sooo cheap. The plastic it's made of is very static and collects dog hairs so I have to vacuum the vacuum before I put it up. I have hardwood and tile floors so prefer the pop out style instead of the heavy carpet style. When I have used the carpet attachment to vacuum a rug it's not the best so if you have carpet buy a different model.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2021

title: See update! This is a POS! Decent vacuum Cheap useless tools

title: Verified Purchase
content: Here's the BAD: the cleaning tools are absolutely WORTHLESS! Hairs collect all over the brush tool. Every few minutes I have to get out the crevice tool to clean the brush. The crevice tool has an opening on the sides and will such in anything around it...like the bed skirt. Even the floor attachment is not that great and hairs and lint collect on the little brush. It doesn't appear to suck up the dust that great because of the design. So a vacuum with a strong motor and great pet tool but the worst attachment tools ever. Honestly they should redesign and send replacements to all who previously purchased this vac. Kenmore is obviously no longer Kenmore. I'll never buy another Kenmore. I purchased this model in August 2021. It was supposed to come with a pet powermate. It did not. The attachments are awful. I still use my older model Kenmore ( however the pet power are no longer works) and this newer model  sits in the closet , is there anything I can do ? Can I get the pet power mate that was supposed to come with this model? Have the attachments improved at all. The brush attachment collects hair and dust but leaves it outside the brush instead of sucking it in the vac. I've had Kenmore canister vacs since 1979. Or is it $400 down the drain and I know  to never ever purchase a Kenmore product again?

title: Much More Than Expected
content: I don't really do reviews, but I have been very impressed with this machine. I have put this machine through its paces except for a shag rug. Most canister vacuums suffer the same fate, I would imagine. This device is a bit cumbersome. I have used it on about 4k sq ft so far on concrete floors, linoleum, low pile, medium pile, and hardwood. Depending on the attachment, it does a great job on every surface. It works great for dusting molding and baseboards as well. My only major issue was cleaning the carpeted stairway with walls on either side. The stair-balancing pieces work great to make sure it says on the stairs with me (within Reason). But with the stiff hose and general size of everything, I was bumping into both walls constantly. Overall, I am extremely happy with this unit.

title: Cleans Great!
content: As soon as I opened the box, you could tell this vacuum was built study. The hose was thick, felt high quality and unlikely to break or bend. The suction has an adjustment knob, which is beneficial for all the different attachments (high suction for my couch covered in dog hair, lower for curtains so you‚Äôre not sucking them up constantly). The hard floor attachment if effective. I do worry some about the abrasiveness of the wheels of the main head but the suction seems appropriate. At first use, it is quick, effective. Also the way the bag collects duct and doesn‚Äôt spread it back through a room is amazing. I‚Äôve had previous canister vacuums that put half the dust back into the room. Bags seems like a pain, but I think that‚Äôs the key to keeping the dust and odors in the vacuum and not in the room.  Looking forward to using this more!
